issue.body: Might be a first (big) step towards #292.

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

body: Hi @marco-c, I started working on it. I'll shout if I'll need any kind of help :)

@marco-c I’m struggling with the installation of `rs_parsepatch` on Alpine Linux. 
I managed to replace all the `apt-get` commands with the `apk` ones, but I got this error during the docker build: 
```
ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement rs_parsepatch (from -r /requirements.txt (line 2)) (from versions: none)ERROR: No matching distribution found for rs_parsepatch (from -r /requirements.txt (line 2))
```

It seems that pip (inside the container) is not able to find `rs_parsepatch`, but this error doesn’t occur if I try to install it locally on my machine or with the `python:3.7-slim` as base image. 
I tried with Alpine linux version 3.9 and 3.10. 
Any idea? 

https://github.com/trampfox/bugbug/tree/switch-to-alpine

@trampfox `rs_parsepatch` is packaged as pre-compiled wheels only (https://pypi.org/project/rs_parsepatch/#files), I don't know enough about Alpine to know how it affects the installation of pre-compiled wheels but you can pass the `--verbose` flag to debug the installation, it will explains why pip choose to not use the file ` rs_parsepatch-0.2.2-cp37-cp37m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl`.

@kanurag94 Which error did you encountered?

If you encountered `/bin/sh: 1: apk: not found`, it's because docker-compose used the Debian-based bugbug-base image to build bugbug-commit-retrieval, try running the following command to solves it:

```bash
docker rmi -f mozilla/bugbug-base:latest
docker-compose build bugbug-base
docker-compose build bugbug-commit-retrieval
```

If you encountered the error:

```
Cloning into '/depot_tools'...
HEAD is now at 73065b20 depot_tools: Make some changes to make metrics collection compatible with Python 3.
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100   630    0   630    0     0   1143      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--  1141
  0 2966k    0 16950    0     0  14713      0  0:03:26  0:00:01  0:03:25 14713rust-code-analysis
100 2966k  100 2966k    0     0   848k      0  0:00:03  0:00:03 --:--:-- 1258k
```

Try splitting the command into several `CMD` line to debug it.
@Lothiraldan Thanks, there was a small extra f in rm command. I'll open a PR since this works now locally

issue.title: Switching to alpine as base image

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

body: hello, can I work on this issue?
Read CONTRIBUTING.md: you can work on any issue which has no open PR linked to it, so you can work on this one.
Hello, I have learned the basics of Docker. Can you please guide me on what to do next.

Now that you know how to use Docker, the issue should be clear :)
You need to switch infra/dockerfile.base to use the Python Alpine image.

Can you please help me 
I am getting an error msg 
"The command '/bin/sh -c apt-get update &&                 apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends gcc g++ libgomp1 &&                 pip install --disable-pip-version-check --no-cache-dir -r /requirements.txt &&                 apt-get remove -y gcc g++ &&                 apt-get autoremove -y &&                 rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*' returned a non-zero code: 127
"
There's not enough info for me to be able to help you.
